references.paper_title: Optimal algorithms for online convex optimization with multi-point bandit feedback
references.reason: This paper is foundational to the understanding of optimal algorithms within online convex optimization, providing a theoretical basis for many subsequent works in zeroth-order optimization.

references.paper_title: Linear interpolation gives better gradients than gaussian smoothing in derivative-free optimization
references.reason: This paper provides theoretical and empirical evidence supporting the use of linear interpolation methods over smoothing techniques for gradient estimation in derivative-free optimization, which is directly relevant to the proposed ReLIZO method.

references.paper_title: A theoretical and empirical comparison of gradient approximations in derivative-free optimization
references.reason: This paper offers a comprehensive comparison of various gradient approximation techniques used in derivative-free optimization, providing valuable context for understanding the strengths and limitations of the proposed ReLIZO approach.

references.paper_title: Stochastic first-and zeroth-order methods for nonconvex stochastic programming
references.reason: This paper introduced foundational stochastic zeroth-order methods for non-convex optimization problems, which serve as a critical starting point for many later advancements in the field, including the proposed ReLIZO method.

references.paper_title: Random gradient-free minimization of convex functions
references.reason: This paper is a seminal work in the field of gradient-free optimization, proposing techniques that are closely related to those explored in the development of ReLIZO and offer a broader theoretical context for understanding its contributions.
